description:
Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 for variations to Conditions 7 (Parameter Plans), 8 (Floorspace Areas), 10 (Distribution of Use Classes), 11 (Maximum Floorspace Areas), 13 (No. of Residential Units) and 61 (Approved Drawings) of the outline planning permission dated 8th November 2016 (ref: 2016/1119) for: 
'the restoration, extension, alterations and conversion of the Power Station building to provide retail, residential flats, business, cultural, hotel and conference facilities, event space and incidental accommodation; the demolition of other buildings and development of the land surrounding the Power Station and adjacent/nearby sites to provide retail, restaurants bars and cafes, offices, hotel, residential, community and cultural space, assembly and leisure space, serviced apartments, an energy centre and basement plant; parking for cars, coaches, motorcycles and bicycles; new access and internal road system and servicing; 'off-site' highway works; works to the jetty and riverwall to facilitate river transport and fuel delivery; provision of open space and landscaping.'

Condition : 1 - 74. Prior to occupation of any Business (Class B1) floorspace, details of the internal illumination of the building, including the lux levels and hours of illumination and position and design of methods of illumination, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. A Management Plan shall provide details of how internal lighting will be controlled in order to minimise light spill post curfew (i.e. after 11pm) in line with the recommendations of the Light Pollution Chapter (Appendix I) of the Environmental Statement Addendum (February 2020). The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained/managed thereafter as per the agreed management plan.
REASON: To protect residents' amenity, in accordance with Council Policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2019.
Condition : 2 - 8. The total gross external floorspace areas of the uses hereby approved (excluding the floorspace within the former Power Station building as extended, the buildings and structures on the jetty and Development Zones RS4 and O1), in accordance with this planning permission shall be limited to the following:

a)	Overall gross external floorspace area of all the uses (excluding parking, servicing, general plant and storage and the energy centre) shall not exceed 362,721sqm;
b)	Retail and professional and financial services (Classes A1/A2) floorspace shall not exceed 9,299sqm (GEA);
c)	Food and drink (Class A3/A4/A5) floorspace shall not exceed 6,649sqm (GEA);
d)	Assembly and leisure (Class D2) floorspace and non-residential institution (Class D1) floorspace shall not exceed 13,335sqm (GEA);
e)	Business (Class B1) floorspace shall not exceed 68,389sqm (GEA);
f)	Serviced apartments (Class C1) floorspace shall not exceed 10,125sqm (GEA); and
g)	Residential (Class C3) floorspace shall not exceed 256,948sqm (GEA).

Reason: To restrict the floorspace of the various uses to the levels proposed and assessed, and to ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development.
Condition : 3 - 11. Subject to further restriction by other conditions attached to this planning permission, the maximum floorspace area to be provided in each Development Zone shall not exceed that set out in the following table: - 

Areas in sqm (GEA)	RS-1	RS-2	RS-5	RS-6	RSWF
Class C3 residential 	92, 267	52,480	76,615	13,651	20,023
Class A1/A2 retail/professional & financial services	2,393	0	6,836	0	0
Class A3/A4/A5 Food & Drink	3,324	1,834	640	0	852
Class B1 business	3,028	48,567	16,794	0	0
Class C1 serviced apartments	0	10,125	0	0	0
Class D1/D2 assembly & leisure/non-residential institution	1,041	3,236	7,483	1,513	0

Reason: To restrict the levels of the floorspace of the various uses within the development to the Development Zone proposed to ensure a suitable mix, balance and distribution of the uses throughout the development.
Condition : 4 - 13. The residential (Class C3) accommodation hereby approved (excluding that within the former Power Station building as extended in accordance with this planning permission and Development Zones O1 and RS4) shall not exceed 2,456 units overall, and the following number of units within each specified Development Zone:

Zone RS-1: 865 units
Zone RS-2: 398 units
Zone RS-5: 883 units
Zone RS-6: 158 units
Zone RSWF: 152 units

The total maximum number of residential units across the site shall not exceed 3,853 units.

Reason: To control the number of residential units, to accord with the planning application and to accord substantially with the number and mix of units set out in the Environmental Statement (November 2015) and its addendums dated February 2016 and February 2020, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policy DMH9.
Condition : 5 - 18. The phasing of the development shall be in accordance with that set out in the Phasing Plan (dated 30 April 2020), unless an updated Phasing Plan is submitted to the Local Planning Authority together with an Environmental Statement complying with the requirements of the Environmental Impact Assessment Regulations 2011 as amended (and any successor thereto), in the event that the Local Planning Authority considers that there is likely to be a significantly different environmental impact arising from the implementation of the updated Phasing Plan, and that updated Phasing Plan is approved by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition (having regard to any Environmental Statement as has been supplied), the phasing of the development shall be in accordance with that set out in the updated Phasing Plan as approved. 

Reason: To control the phasing of the development, to accord with the planning application, and to accord substantially with the assessments set out in the Environmental Statement dated July 2009 and its addendums dated June 2010, September 2010, May 2013, June 2013 and February 2020. 
Condition : 6 - 19. The landscape works and planting as may be approved for each Phase of the development shall be carried out in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority, pursuant to this condition, prior to occupation of 70% of the relevant phase of the development. Details of the hard and soft landscaping for that part of the development approved in detail, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of landscaping works in the relevant phase.
a) The details shall include all street furniture, boundary treatment, fencing between private and public areas, lighting, cycle stands, seating, bins and play equipment, including their scale, design, materials and location.
b) The location of trees and other planting which projects above the balustrade on the roof garden in Development Zone O1 shall be in general accordance with drawings A-1244 and A-1245 (both Rev 02).
c) The details shall include the wind mitigation measures identified in the Environmental Statement and Environmental Statement Addendum (February 2020).
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details as approved. The details approved on the 06th June 2016 (ref: 2016/2790) have discharged the programme requirements in relation to Phase 1.

Reason: In order that the landscaping is provided in co-ordination with the phasing of development construction to an appropriate timetable, such that areas of amenity space and public realm are provided in a timely fashion for the benefit of residents and the public. To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development, privacy for future residents, and to maintain the area of low-level planting designed to avoid interrupting visibility of the Power Station chimneys from Queenstown Road in accordance with policy DMS1.
Condition : 7 - 22. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved on the 31st July 2015 (ref: 2015/2916); or in accordance with an updated site wide strategy as may be approved in writing by the local planning authority pursuant to this condition. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall include pricing structure (to include pricing to deter commuter parking); means of separating public, operational and residential parking and enforcing that separation; allocation of residential spaces between market and affordable units; approach to allocation of parking for people with mobility problems and wheelchair users; car club allocation; cycle parking/storage differentiated by residential, public and other users; charging points for electric vehicles; means of control on parking at ground level and a scheme for enforcement; access controls to the underground parking; and, handling the relationship between private and service vehicles. The Site Wide Parking Management Strategy shall be reviewed prior to commencement of each Phase of development and a Car Parking Management Plan providing the detail of how the Car Park Management Strategy will be applied to each Development Zone or Phase, as appropriate, shall be submitted prior to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of excavation works associated with that Zone or Phase. The details approved on the 17th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3327), 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7027) and 31st July 2015 (ref: 2015/2916) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1, Phase 2 and Phase 3A respectively. Phase 3B shall be operated in accordance with the Car Park Management Plan included at Appendix A of the Transport Statement (February 2020 Rev C) by Markides Associates. The details submitted in accordance with Condition 3 shall be in accordance with the Site Wide Parking Management Strategy and appropriate Car Parking Management Plan. T
Condition : 8 - 36. A Sustainable Waste Strategy shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval for each Phase of the development. No Phase of development shall commence until details of the methods and designated areas and locations for storage and separation of general and recyclable waste and the means of its disposal have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing, in association with the details required under Condition 03. The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), and the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193), have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1; and the details approved on the 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7029) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 2. Phase 3B shall be operated in accordance with the details set out in the Transport Statement (February 2020 Rev C) by Markides Associates. Such details shall be implemented in accordance with the Sustainable Waste Strategy as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition. The designated locations shall be retained in the completed development unless alternative arrangements are submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To mitigate the quantity of waste arising from the operation of the development, ensure appropriate provision is made for storage and disposal, and to minimise the environmental impacts from that waste in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 9 - 38. The Site Wide Construction Management Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved on the 17th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3954); or in accordance with updated details as may be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition. The Site Wide Construction Management Plan shall then be reviewed and updated prior to commencement of each Phase of development and an amended version shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to commencement of the relevant Phase, pursuant to this condition. The Construction Management Plan shall include specific details for:-
(a) the control of noise and vibration, and hours of noisy activities;
(b) a waste and material management, transportation and disposal strategy, including delivery booking and vehicle holding arrangements, and targets and arrangements for maximising the use of the river for 'muck away' and material delivery where feasible;
(c) air quality measures for the control and monitoring of dust, fine particles and odours;
(d) construction methods and timing in relation to effects on river fauna (including potential re-suspension of intertidal deposits), peregrine falcons, black redstarts, and bats.
(e) construction traffic routing through the area, and an enforcement system for breach of its provisions. 
(f) piling or other penetrative methods of foundation design in relation to risks to underlying groundwater, and underground infrastructure.
The details approved on the 17th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3977), the 7th November 2013 (ref: 2013/4449), the 20th April 2015 (ref: 2015/0393) and 25th February 2016 (2015/6502) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1, the Phase 2 Preliminary Works, the Phase 2 Main Works and Phase 3A respectively. Phase 3B shall be operated in accordance with the Construction Management Plan (May 2020 Rev 03) by Sir Robert McAlpine. The development shall not be undert
Condition : 10 - 46. Reports providing supplementary Flood Risk Assessments for each development Phase shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to development commencing in that Phase. These documents shall be based on the principles set out in the Flood Risk Assessment by Buro Happold (ref. 023000 dated July 2009). They should be prepared in accordance with the latest national guidance and the latest available information on flood risk and climate change. The details approved on the 12th August 2013 (ref: 2013/2641), the 15th September 2014 (ref: 2014/4580) and the 5th December 2014 (ref. 2014/2837) have discharged the foregoing requirement in relation to Phases 1, 2 and 3A, respectively. Phase 3B shall be undertaken in accordance with the Flood Risk Assessment (May 2020 Revision P04) by Robert Bird & Partners Ltd. Prior to first occupation of any part of the development within that Phase, a Flood Evacuation Plan based on the FRA approved for that Phase and incorporating the latest modelled data to confirm the potential risk and depths of flooding in and around the site, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The measures identified in the reports as may be approved shall then be implemented in full unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To reduce risk of flooding to the proposed development and future occupants in line with Core Strategy policy IS4 and DMPD policies DMS5 and DMS6.
Condition : 11 - 49. Development of any individual Phase of development shall not commence until a Surface Water Drainage Scheme for that Phase, based on sustainable drainage principles has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. This should be in accordance with the agreed Site Wide Surface Water Drainage Strategy by Buro Happold (dated July 2009). The scheme should include disposal of surface water drainage to the River Thames via positive gravity/symphonic drainage. Connections to the surface water drainage network shall be constructed for each phase in accordance with the Site Wide Surface Water Drainage Strategy. The details approved on the 15th October 2013 (ref: 2013/4078), and the 15th September 2014 (ref: 2014/4532) and the 5th December 2014 (ref: 2014/2837) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phases 1, 2 and 3A, respectively. Phase 3B shall be undertaken in accordance with the Phase 3 Drainage Strategy Addendum set out in Appendix A of the Flood Risk Assessment (May 2020 Revision P04) by Robert Bird & Partners Ltd. The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To prevent the increased risk of flooding, and to ensure future maintenance of the surface water drainage system, in line with Core Strategy policy IS4 and DMPD policies DMS6 and DMS7.
Condition : 12 - 59. The Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved on the 15th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3280); or in accordance with an updated Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy as may be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition. The Strategy shall provide an overarching strategy for servicing and deliveries including access controls, regimes for planning and timing of deliveries, and handling the relationship between private and service vehicles, and the provision of utilities throughout the site. The Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy shall be reviewed prior to commencement of each phase of development and a Servicing Management Plan providing the detail, including drawings, of how the Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy will be applied to each Development Zone or Phase, as appropriate, shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details to be provided under conditions 03, 22 and 25, together with the any reviewed Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy as appropriate, prior to commencement of excavation works associated with that Development Zone or Phase. The details approved on the 15th October 2013 (ref: 2013/3280), the 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7027) and the 31st July 2015 (2015/2916) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1, Phase 2 and Phase 3A respectively. Phase 3B shall be operated in accordance with the Delivery and Servicing Plan included at Appendix B of the Transport Statement (February 2020 Rev C) by Markides Associates. The development shall not be operated otherwise than in accordance with the Site Wide Servicing Management Strategy and Servicing Management Plans as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.
Reason: To ensure appropriate provision 
Condition : 13 - 67. Notwithstanding that shown on the drawings hereby approved, details of the following elements of Phase 3 (including 3A, 3B and 3C as relevant) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of the relevant works:

A) Drawings at an appropriate scale showing detailed design and use of materials in respect of:
i.	Roof level excrescences, including edge protection, lift overruns, building maintenance units, trees and other structures;
ii.	Typical faade bay details, including building entrances, winter gardens, balconies and oriel windows;
iii.	Retail shopfronts;
iv.	Distribution and internal configuration of residential and commercial units layouts;
v.	The internal configuration of the basement levels;
vi.	The Community Hub in Prospect Park;
vii.	The hotel entrance and drop-off arrangements;
viii.	The balustrades to the ground floor terrace of the O1 building, and the communal courtyard garden of the RS4 buildings;

B)    Samples of materials to be used on all external surfaces.

The relevant work shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with such details as may be approved.

Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development.
Condition : 14 - 1. This development shall be begun within 5 years from the 23rd August 2011, or within 2 years from the 20th December 2012 being the date of the first approval of the reserved matters (ref: 2012/4584) relating to Phase 1 of the development (as set out on the phasing plan - figure 5.1 of the Transport Assessment (May 2014) (Phase 1), whichever is the later.

Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 15 - 2. Phase 1 of the development shall be carried out in accordance with the reserved matters approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4584), the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1192), the 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229), the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2320), the 8th November 2016 (ref: 2016/5098), the 18th May 2017 (ref: 2017/1248) and the 8th January 2020 (ref: 2019/4769) pursuant to condition 3 of the outline planning permission dated 23rd August 2011 (ref: 2009/3575); or in accordance with reserved matters approved pursuant to condition 3 of this permission. 

Reason: To ensure these Phases are implemented in accordance with the approved detailed permissions and reserved matters.
Condition : 16 - 3. Approval of details of the following reserved matters shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in respect of each Phase of development other than the former Power Station Building (Phase 2) and Development Zones O1 and RS4 (Phases 3A, 3B and 3C) as set out on the Phasing Plan (dated 30 April 2020), unless an updated Phasing Plan is submitted to the Local Planning Authority pursuant to Condition 18 of this permission:-
(a) the scale of the buildings and structures within that phase;
(b) the external appearance of those buildings and structures, including facing materials; and
(c) landscaping of that phase.
The reserved matters approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4584), the 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1192), the 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229), the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2320), the 8th November 2016 (ref: 2016/5098), the 18th May 2017 (ref: 2017/1248) and the 8th January 2020 (ref: 2019/4769) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1.

Reason: To comply with Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. Planning policy will evolve throughout the development and the reserved matters applications should take account of this.
Condition : 17 - 4. None of the works which are the subject of the details required in condition 03 shall be commenced without the prior written approval of those details by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied as to the details of the development.
Condition : 18 - 5. The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the elements in the Architectural Code (June 2010) and the Architectural Design Code Addendum (May 2013), the Phase 6 Architectural Code Addendum (November 2015), and any subsequent reviews and updates to the Architectural Code, identified as mandatory within that Code.

Reason: To control the appearance and architectural form of the development, and to ensure a high quality and co-ordinated design for the built form, in accordance with policy IS3 of the Core Strategy (Adopted March 2016), and policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (Adopted March 2016) (DMPD).
Condition : 19 - 6. The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the elements in the Placemaking Code (June 2010) and the Placemaking Code Addendum (December 2013), the Phase 6 Placemaking Code Addendum (November 2015), and any subsequent reviews or updates to the Placemaking Code, identified as mandatory within that Code and shall demonstrate how accessibility for people with disabilities is incorporated within all areas of public realm.

Reason: To control the appearance of the development and to ensure a high quality and co-ordinated design for the landscaping, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. In order to ensure that people with disabilities can satisfactorily use and access the finished development, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 20 - 7. The details submitted in relation to condition 03 shall be in accordance with the scale and massing limitations set by the submitted parameter plans specified in this schedule.

Reason: The merits and environmental impacts of the proposed development have been assessed in relation to the form of the development shown on the submitted parameter plans. In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which an Environmental Impact Assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1.
Condition : 21 - 8. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 22 - 9. No extensions of floorspace in addition to that shown on the submitted drawings specified in this schedule shall be provided in, on or below the Power Station building without the express approval of the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition or by a further planning permission in that regard.

Reason: To restrict the extent of uses in, on or below the Power Station building to those proposed and assessed, and to ensure a suitable mix of uses within the development.
Condition : 23 - 10. The distribution of Classes of Use within the Power Station building (Phase 2) and Development Zones O1 and RS4 (Phases 3A, 3B and 3C), as set out on the Phasing Plan (dated 30 April 2020), unless an updated Phasing Plan is submitted to the Local Planning Authority pursuant to Condition 18 of this permission, shall not be otherwise than as shown on the submitted drawings specified in this schedule.

Reason: In assessing the scheme, the local planning authority has had regard to the appropriateness of the manner in which the various uses have been arranged and distributed within the Power Station building and Development Zones O1 and RS4, and would wish to control any adjustments to the submitted arrangements.
Condition : 24 - 11. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 25 - 12. The distribution of uses within each Development Zone or Phase shall be in accordance with the parameter plans hereby approved unless otherwise submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition or a further planning permission is granted in that behalf. The details approved on the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1.

Reason: The impacts and the suitability of the various uses within the proposed development have been assessed in relation to their distribution across the site, as shown on the submitted parameter plans. In order to ensure the development proceeds on the basis of the scheme on which the assessment has been undertaken, the permission needs to be substantially tied to the details assessed, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 26 - 13. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 27 - 14. The residential accommodation (excluding that within the former Power Station building as extended in accordance with this planning permission) shall include units of a mix of sizes substantially in accordance with the following mix:
"	Studio units:                   11%
"	1 bedroom units:            24%
"	2 bedroom units:            42%
"	3 bedroom units:            16%
"	4 bedroom units:            2% 
"	Penthouse units:            5%

Reason: To replicate the unit mix of the residential accommodation to that assessed and, in general accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5 and DMPD policy DMH3.
Condition : 28 - 15. Details of the distribution and internal configuration of residential units shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The details shall show how policy and supplementary guidance in effect at the time of the reserved matters approvals will be met. All units shall be in accordance with the Mayor's Housing Standards, the DCLG's Technical Housing Standards, and 90% of the units shall meet Building Regulation requirement M4(2) 'accessible and adaptable dwellings' and 10% of the units shall meet Building Regulation requirement M4(3) 'wheelchair user dwellings'. The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193), 20th December 2013 (ref: 2013/4229), and the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory residential accommodation is provided, including for people with disabilities, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS5, and DMPD policy DMH4.
Condition : 29 - 16. No development, other than those elements specified as exceptions below, shall commence on any part of the development until one of the following two events has occurred:- 

(1) the extension to the London Underground Northern Line from Kennington to a new station on the Battersea Power Station site ("NLE") has been constructed and is open to passengers; or,
(2) The following five requirements are met:

a.	an Order has been made by the Secretary of State under the Transport and Works Act 1992 authorising the construction of an extension to the London Underground Northern Line comprising a new station on the Battersea Power Station site and the entire running tunnel from Kennington station to that new station, together with necessary ancillary works ("NLE phase 1"), and an additional station between Kennington and that new station ("the TWAO Scheme") and such order includes a direction by the Secretary of State pursuant to section 90(2A) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 that planning permission for the TWAO Scheme shall be deemed to be granted (subject to such conditions (if any) as may be specified in such direction); 
b.	TfL has let a construction contract for NLE phase 1; 
c.	TfL has confirmed to the local planning authority in writing that the work has commenced under that construction contract;
d.	an agreement is in place with London Underground Limited or Transport for London providing for the arrangements to bring at least NLE phase 1 into operation; and
e.	confirmation and evidence of the matters in (a) to (d) above has been provided to the local planning authority.  

The exceptions are:-

i.	works for the repair, and development of the Power Station building (including basement and extension works and works for the benefit of the wider development within the Phase 2 area as shown on the phasing plan (as identified in Figure 5.1 in the Transport Assessment, May 2014);
ii.	the construction of the energy centre and associated service
Condition : 30 - 17. Condition deleted under application 2014/2837.
Condition : 31 - 18. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 32 - 19. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 33 - 20. The car parking provided on the site shall not exceed a maximum of 3,094 spaces. No more than 1,448 of those spaces shall be available for use by the public, and no more than 68 of the spaces shall be allocated to or provided in connection with the Class B1 business use. Details of the proposed land use for the flexible A1-A5 floorspace within the Power Station Building are to be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing prior to the commencement of that use, and the maximum car parking provision for this floorspace is to be calculated in accordance with the approved car parking ratios contained within the Transport Assessment (May 2014) and Transport Assessment Addendum (July 2014). The maximum caps for the total number of car parking spaces on the site and for use by the public shall be set taking account of this provision subject to the absolute maximums stated in this condition.

Reason: To avoid creating unacceptable traffic congestion on the surrounding road network and adversely affecting the amenity of local residents and businesses, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policies DMT1 and DMT2.
Condition : 34 - 21. The maximum level of parking to be provided for the Class C3 residential use shall not exceed a level in compliance with the following ratios for each Development Zone, subject to the overall caps stated:

Zone RS-1:       0.5 spaces per unit capped at 433
Zone RS-2:       0.41 spaces per unit capped at 164
Zone RS-4:       0.41 spaces per unit capped at 282
Zone RS-5:       0.41 spaces per unit capped at 128
Zone RS-6a:     0.41 spaces per unit capped at 52
Zone RS-6b:     0.1 spaces per unit capped at 3
Zone RSWF:     0.41 spaces per unit capped at 62
Zone O-1:         0.41 spaces per unit capped at 253
Power Station:  capped at 130 spaces.

Reason: To limit the number of parking spaces within each Development Zone having regard to the characteristics of accommodation within each zone and the phasing of the development, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 35 - 22. See Revised Condition and Reason
Condition : 36 - 23. A minimum of 10% of all the parking spaces hereby approved shall be suitable for the use of wheelchair users and shall be provided in accordance with the details as may be approved under condition 22. The spaces shall be permanently retained for persons with mobility disabilities.

Reason: To ensure that adequate parking facilities for people with disabilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 37 - 24. The parking areas as may be approved in relation to the Power Station Building and the Development Zones shall be provided before the first occupation of the floorspace to which it is associated in the relevant Development Zone or Power Station as appropriate. The car parking serving the non-residential accommodation within the Development Zone RS-1 is to be provided in accordance with the note 'Delivery of Basement Car Parking Provision - Phase 1 Circus West' dated April 2016.

Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for off-street parking and to avoid creating unacceptable traffic congestion on the surrounding road network and adversely affecting the amenity of local residents and businesses, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policies DMT1 and DMT2.
Condition : 38 - 25. Details of coach, bus, taxi and ground level cycle parking, and service area provision shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193) and the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1; and the details approved on 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7029) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 2. The provision as may be approved shall be provided and permanently retained for the prescribed uses unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To ensure appropriate facilities are provided and retained on site, in accordance policy Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.
Condition : 39 - 26. Details, including plans, of the individual size, configuration, access and servicing arrangements, and separation of one from another, of the commercial, community, leisure and institutional units shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing in association with the details required under condition 03. The details approved on the 20th December 2012 (ref: 2012/4586), 8th May 2013 (ref: 2013/1193), and the 2nd November 2015 (ref: 2015/2321) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 1; and the details approved on the 10th March 2015 (ref: 2014/7029) have discharged the foregoing requirements in relation to Phase 2. The development shall not be implemented otherwise than in accordance with those details as may be approved unless subsequent alternative details are submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority pursuant to this condition.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory dispersion of units, and that adequate access and servicing arrangements are provided and retained on site, in accordance with Core Strategy policy IS1, and DMPD policy DMT2.

This process for the collection of CIL includes:  the requirement to complete an "Assumption of Liability" form as soon as possible;  in order to claim charitable exemption or social housing relief or other forms of relief you or the relevant interested party should also complete a "Claiming Exemption or Relief" form. 
The Council will, if appropriate, then issue a Liability Notice(s) which details the charges due. It can also mean that any exemptions or reliefs are lost.
General information on the Community Infrastructure Levy, including the forms mentioned above can be found on the Planning Portal (www.planningportal.gov.uk).
